title.text: Performatives in a Rationally Based Speech Act Theory*

abstractContent.text: 1 Introduction A crucially important adequacy test of any theory of speech acts is its ability to handle perfor-matives.
This paper provides a theory of perfor-matives as a test case for our rationally based theory of illocutionary acts.
We show why "I request you..." is a request, and "I lie to you that p" is self-defeating.

The analysis supports and extends earlier work of theorists such as Bach and Harnish [1] and takes issue with recent claims by Searle [10] that such performative-as-declarative analyses are doomed to failure.
